item.title: 美国为小型核试验反应堆快速通道计划挑选 11 家公司
item.description: 美国能源部周二表示，它已初步选定 11 家公司参与一项旨在开发高科技试验核反应堆的试点计划，并让其中至少三家公司在不到一年的时间内开始运行。【原文：The U.S. Department of Energy said on Tuesday it has made an initial selection of 11 companies for a pilot program seeking to develop high-tech test nuclear reactors and get at least three of them to begin operating in less than a year.】

item.title: 人工智能需求强劲，CoreWeave 季度收入超出预期
item.description: 本周二，CoreWeave 的第二季度营收超过了华尔街的预期，原因是市场对这家由英伟达（Nvidia）支持的人工智能云计算公司的服务需求加速增长。【原文：CoreWeave topped Wall Street estimates for second-quarter revenue on Tuesday, driven by accelerating demand for the Nvidia-backed AI cloud computing firm's services.】

item.title: 白宫表示，美国计划继续发布月度就业报告
item.description: 白宫周二表示，按照 "计划"，劳工统计局将继续发布其备受关注的月度就业报告，此前，唐纳德-特朗普总统挑选的劳工统计局局长提议暂停发布该报告，同时解决导致近期就业增长预估出现历史性大幅修正的问题。【原文：The White House on Tuesday said it is "the plan" that the Bureau of Labor Statistics will continue to publish its closely watched monthly employment report after President Donald Trump's pick to head the agency proposed suspending its release while it addresses problems that resulted in historically large revisions to recent job growth estimates.】

item.title: CPI 公布后，投资者加倍看好美联储 9 月降息
item.description: 上个月通胀率温和上扬，表明唐纳德-特朗普总统的全面进口关税对商品价格的传导迄今为止还很有限，因此投资者加大了对美联储 9 月份降息的押注。【原文：Investors are betting harder on a September Federal Reserve interest rate cut after last month's mild inflation bump, which indicated the pass-through from President Donald Trump's sweeping import duties to goods prices has so far been limited.】

item.title: 加航空乘人员在可能的罢工前拒绝接受具有约束力的仲裁
item.description: 加拿大公共雇员工会（Canadian Union of Public Employees）周二表示，加航空乘人员拒绝了航空公司提出的具有约束力的仲裁建议，并继续进行直接谈判。【原文：Air Canada flight attendants rejected the airline's proposal for binding arbitration on Tuesday and continued direct talks, the Canadian Union of Public Employees said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 纽约时报》报道：俄罗斯被怀疑是美国联邦法院文件系统遭黑客攻击的幕后黑手
item.description: 据《纽约时报》周二援引几位知情人士的话报道，调查人员发现有证据表明，俄罗斯至少对最近黑客入侵管理美国联邦法院文件的计算机系统负有部分责任。【原文：Investigators have uncovered evidence that Russia is at least in part responsible for a recent hack of the computer system that manages U.S. federal court documents, the New York Times reported on Tuesday, citing several people briefed on the breach.】

item.title: 能源部长表示，如果埃克森公司在特立尼达发现石油和天然气，将投资高达 217 亿美元
item.description: 能源部长鲁达尔-穆尼拉尔（Roodal Moonilal）表示，如果埃克森美孚在特立尼达和多巴哥计划勘探石油和天然气的大片深水区发现储量，这家能源巨头可能会在特立尼达和多巴哥投资多达 217 亿美元。【原文：Exxon Mobil could invest as much as $21.7 billion in Trinidad and Tobago if the energy major finds reserves in a large deepwater area it plans to explore for oil and gas in the Caribbean country, energy minister Roodal Moonilal said.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，加拿大房地产软件供应商 Altus 集团正在探索出售事宜
item.description: 本周二，两位熟悉内情的人士称，专注于房地产行业的加拿大软件和数据分析提供商 Altus Group 在收到收购意向后，正在探索潜在的出售方案。【原文：Altus Group , a Canadian software and data analytics provider focused on the real estate industry, is exploring a potential sale after receiving inbound acquisition interest, two people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 巴西橙汁副产品将受到特朗普关税的影响
item.description: 行业贸易组织 CitrusBR 周二表示，由于美国 8 月初对巴西许多产品征收 50%的高额关税，巴西橙汁副产品出口商的收入将大幅下降。【原文：Brazilian exporters of orange juice byproducts will suffer a major revenue decline from a hefty 50% U.S. tariff imposed on many of the country's products in early August, industry trade group CitrusBR said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 白宫称特朗普正考虑就装修问题起诉美联储主席鲍威尔
item.description: 白宫发言人卡罗琳-利维特（Karoline Leavitt）周二表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普正在考虑对美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）就其管理美联储华盛顿总部装修一事提起诉讼。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump is considering a lawsuit against Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell related to his management of renovations at the Fed's Washington headquarters, White House spokeswoman Karoline Leavitt said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 尽管关税收入激增，美国 7 月赤字仍增至 2910 亿美元
item.description: 美国财政部周二表示，尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收关税带来了 210 亿美元的关税收入，但美国政府 7 月份的预算赤字仍增长了近 20%，达到 2910 亿美元，支出增长快于收入增长。【原文：The U.S. government's budget deficit grew nearly 20% in July to $291 billion despite a $21 billion jump in customs duty collections from President Donald Trump's tariffs, with outlays growing faster than receipts, the Treasury Department said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 白宫称芯片交易可能会扩展到其他公司
item.description: 白宫周二表示，在英伟达（Nvidia）和先进微设备公司（Advanced Micro Devices）同意向美国政府提供向中国销售某些先进芯片收入的 15%之后，或许可以将交易扩大到其他芯片公司。【原文：The White House said on Tuesday that perhaps deals could be expanded to other chip companies after Nvidia and Advanced Micro Devices agreed to give the U.S. government 15% of revenue from sales to China of certain advanced chips.】

item.title: 消息人士称，ProSieben 投资方 General Atlantic 选择捷克保障基金报价，避开 MFE
item.description: 两位熟悉此事的人士周二告诉路透社，金融投资者 General Atlantic 已将其持有的德国媒体集团 ProSiebenSat.1 2.4% 的股份转让给捷克投资公司 PPF。【原文：Financial investor General Atlantic has tendered its 2.4% stake in German media group ProSiebenSat.1 to Czech investment company PPF, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州起诉礼来公司，指控其贿赂医疗服务提供者以开具其药品处方
item.description: 得克萨斯州总检察长肯-帕克斯顿（Ken Paxton）周二起诉美国制药商礼来公司，指控其 "贿赂 "医疗服务提供者开具其药品处方。【原文：Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton on Tuesday sued U.S. drugmaker Eli Lilly for allegedly "bribing" providers to prescribe its medications.】

item.title: 机票数据显示定价能力增强，美国航空公司股价大涨
item.description: 周二，美国主要航空公司股价大涨，因为7月份乐观的机票价格数据表明，随着航空公司调整运力以适应疲软的需求环境，美国航空业的定价能力正在提高。【原文：Shares of major U.S. carriers jumped on Tuesday after upbeat airfare data for July signaled improving pricing power for the industry, as airlines bring capacity in check to align with a soft demand environment.】

item.title: 特朗普斥责高盛所罗门和该银行关于关税影响的经济学研究
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周二表示，消费者并未支付关税成本，并反驳了高盛（Goldman Sachs）研究部门最近的一项估计，即截至 6 月份，消费者已吸收了 22% 的关税成本。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday consumers are not paying the costs of tariffs, countering a recent Goldman Sachs' research division estimate that they had absorbed 22% of the costs through June.】

item.title: 美国将对支持净零排放计划的国际海事组织成员进行报复
item.description: 美国周二拒绝了国际海事组织提出的旨在减少全球航运业温室气体排放的 "净零框架 "建议，并威胁要对支持该建议的国家采取措施。【原文：The U.S. on Tuesday rejected the Net-Zero Framework proposal by the International Maritime Organization, which is aimed at reducing global greenhouse gas emissions from the international shipping sector, and threatened measures against countries that support it.】

item.title: 米兰称美联储的独立性 "至关重要"，但拒绝详述 - CNBC
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普提名的美联储理事会成员周二表示，美国中央银行的独立性 "至关重要"，但他拒绝进一步阐述，理由是参议院即将对其进行审批。【原文：President Donald Trump's nominee to the Federal Reserve Board of Governors on Tuesday said the U.S. central bank's independence was 'of paramount importance' but declined to elaborate further, citing his coming approval process in the Senate.】

item.title: 人工智能初创公司 Perplexity 大胆出价 345 亿美元收购谷歌 Chrome 浏览器
item.description: Perplexity AI 表示，它已主动向 Alphabet 的 Chrome 浏览器提出了 345 亿美元的全现金收购要约，出价低但很大胆，所需的融资远远高于这家初创公司自身的估值。【原文：Perplexity AI said it has made a $34.5 billion unsolicited all-cash offer for Alphabet's Chrome browser, a low but bold bid that would need financing well above the startup's own valuation.】

item.title: 印度 Paytm 支付服务公司获央行批准作为在线支付聚合商运营
item.description: 印度金融科技公司 Paytm 周二表示，其部门 Paytm 支付服务已获得印度中央银行的 "原则性 "批准，可以作为在线支付聚合商运营。【原文：Indian fintech firm Paytm on Tuesday said its unit Paytm Payments Services has got 'in-principle' approval from the country's central bank to operate as an online payment aggregator.】

item.title: 巴西 7 月咖啡消费价格 18 个月来首次下降
item.description: 周二公布的巴西全国消费价格总指数（IPCA）数据显示，7月份巴西咖啡消费价格下降了1.01%，为18个月来首次下降。【原文：Brazil's consumer coffee prices fell 1.01% in July, the first drop in 18 months, according to data from the country's Broad National Consumer Price Index (IPCA) published on Tuesday.】

item.title: 系统故障导致短暂停飞后，西捷航空恢复航班
item.description: 西捷航空公司（WestJet Airlines）周二表示，该公司正在恢复正常运营，此前该公司曾因临时系统故障被迫短暂停止所有航班的起飞。【原文：WestJet Airlines said on Tuesday a return to normal operations was underway after a temporary system outage had forced the Canadian carrier to briefly halt all departures.】

item.title: 立法者称智利当局已开始调查阿尔贝马锂电厂事故
item.description: 一名当地立法者周二告诉路透社记者，继上周报道了一起事故后，智利当局已对 Albemarle 公司的 La Negra 锂加工厂展开调查。【原文：Chilean authorities have opened an investigation into Albemarle's La Negra lithium processing plant following an accident reported last week, a local lawmaker told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 波音公司七月份飞机交付量比六月份下降 20%，落后于空中客车公司
item.description: 美国飞机制造商波音公司周二表示，该公司7月份交付了48架飞机，低于6月份的60架，但比去年同期增加了5架。这是该公司自2017年以来交付飞机最多的7月份，当时交付了58架飞机。【原文：U.S. planemaker Boeing said on Tuesday that it delivered 48 airplanes in July, down from 60 in June but five more than a year earlier. It was the most deliveries by the company in July since 2017, when it delivered 58 aircraft.】

item.title: 杜权将承认在 400 亿美元加密货币崩盘案中的美国共谋和欺诈指控
item.description: 一名法官在美国法院的听证会上说，韩国加密货币企业家权斗（Do Kwon）计划于周二承认共谋诈骗和电信欺诈两项指控。【原文：Do Kwon, the South Korean cryptocurrency entrepreneur behind two digital currencies that lost an estimated $40 billion in 2022, is planning to plead guilty on Tuesday to two charges of conspiracy to defraud and wire fraud, a judge said at a U.S. court hearing.】

item.title: 施密德：美联储政策利率应暂时按兵不动
item.description: 堪萨斯城联储主席杰弗里-施密德（Jeffrey Schmid）周二表示，美国央行不应将关税迄今为止对通胀的微弱影响视为降息的契机，而应将其视为货币政策 "校准适当 "的标志，他的这番言论与他的一些同事日益鸽派的基调形成了鲜明对比。【原文：The U.S. central bank should not take tariffs' muted effect on inflation so far as an opportunity to cut interest rates, but rather as a sign that monetary policy is "appropriately calibrated," Kansas City Federal Reserve President Jeffrey Schmid said on Tuesday, in remarks that contrast with the increasingly dovish tone of some of his colleagues.】

item.title: 戴姆勒、沃尔沃和其他卡车制造商起诉加州，要求阻止排放规则的实施
item.description: 包括戴姆勒和沃尔沃在内的四大卡车制造商起诉加利福尼亚州，要求阻止该州执行美国总统唐纳德-特朗普 6 月份宣布无效的严格排放标准。【原文：Four major truckmakers, including Daimler and Volvo, sued California to block the state from enforcing strict emissions standards that U.S. President Donald Trump declared void in June.】

item.title: EIA 称，2024 年美国一次能源产出的 30% 用于出口
item.description: 美国能源信息署（EIA）周二称，去年美国出口的能源约占其国内初级能源产量的 30%，与近几十年相比有了大幅增长。【原文：The United States exported about 30% of its domestic primary energy production last year, a significant increase over recent decades, the Energy Information Administration (EIA) said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特朗普援引针对美联储鲍威尔的 "重大诉讼"，再次敦促降息
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周二再次呼吁美国联邦储备委员会（U.S. Federal Reserve）降低基准利率，并列举了针对美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）有关央行大楼装修的 "重大诉讼"。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday reiterated his call for the U.S. Federal Reserve to lower benchmark rates, and cited "a major lawsuit" against Fed Chair Jerome Powell over renovations of the central bank's buildings.】

item.title: 里士满联储主席巴金消费者将是未来通胀和就业结果的关键
item.description: 里士满联储主席汤姆-巴尔金（Tom Barkin）周二表示，消费者的积极购物行为可能会削弱关税对通胀的影响，但也可能导致需求下降和失业率上升的循环。【原文：Aggressive shopping by consumers may mute the impact of tariffs on inflation but could also lead to a cycle of falling demand and rising unemployment, Richmond Fed president Tom Barkin said on Tuesday, while adding he is hopeful a sharp rise in the jobless rate will be avoided because household spending has held up well so far.】
